definitions.definition: To deliberately take hold of; to grab or capture .
To take advantage of (an opportunity or circumstance ).
To take possession of (by force, law etc.).
examples: to seize a ship after libeling

definitions.definition: To have a sudden and powerful effect upon.
Alternative spelling of seise ( “ to vest ownership of an estate in land ” ) .
To bind , lash or make fast , with several turns of small rope, cord, or small line.
examples: to seize two fish-hooks back to back
to seize or stop one rope on to another

definitions.definition: To lay hold in seizure , by hands or claws (+ on or upon ).
examples: to seize on the neck of a horse

definitions.definition: To bind or lock in position immovably ; see also seize up .
examples: Rust caused the engine to seize , never to run again.

definitions.definition: To submit for consideration to a deliberative body.
To cause (an action or matter) to be or remain before (a certain judge or court).
examples: This Court will remain seized of this matter.

definitions.definition: Of chocolate : to change suddenly from a fluid to an undesirably hard and gritty texture .

main_definition: ( transitive ) To deliberately take hold of; to grab or capture .
secondary_definitions: ( transitive ) To take advantage of (an opportunity or circumstance ).
( transitive ) To take possession of (by force, law etc.).
( transitive ) To have a sudden and powerful effect upon.
( transitive , law ) Alternative spelling of seise ( “ to vest ownership of an estate in land ” ) .
( transitive , nautical ) To bind , lash or make fast , with several turns of small rope, cord, or small line.
( intransitive ) To lay hold in seizure , by hands or claws (+ on or upon ).
( intransitive ) To bind or lock in position immovably ; see also seize up .
( UK , intransitive ) To submit for consideration to a deliberative body.
( law ) (with of ) To cause (an action or matter) to be or remain before (a certain judge or court).
( ambitransitive , cooking ) Of chocolate : to change suddenly from a fluid to an undesirably hard and gritty texture .
